title: test_pstrf is fallacious
body_html:
test_pstrf tests pstrf on positive definite matrices instead of testing on positive semi definite matrices. This caused us to not catch errors like #12435 .

The culprit is this segment of code:
https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/test/test_torch.py#L5379-L5381

Removing this segment produces errors about the input matrix being rank deficient. Rank deficiency for a real symmetric matrix is when at least one of the eigenvalues is zero. This scenario is plausible for positive semi definite matrices by definition.

cc: @zou3519

cc: @zou3519
body:
`test_pstrf` tests pstrf on positive definite matrices instead of testing on positive semi definite matrices. This caused us to not catch errors like #12435 .

The culprit is this segment of code:
https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/test/test_torch.py#L5379-L5381

Removing this segment produces errors about the input matrix being rank deficient. Rank deficiency for a real symmetric matrix is when at least one of the eigenvalues is zero. This scenario is plausible for positive semi definite matrices by definition.

cc: @zou3519
